choices.A: Object Storage on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure
choices.D: locally attached NVMe on Virtual Machine

discussion.content: Answer is A: Object Storage transported by Service Gateway.

questions.question_text: What is the default backup location for database backup on Database Cloud Service (DBCS)?

discussion.content: A is correct. D. It can be restored as new volumes with different sizes from the backups.” because the option D says “with different sizes” and you can only increase the size of the volume, you cannot decrease the size.

A IS correct

Reference: 
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Block/Concepts/blockvolumebackups.htm
Backups are encrypted and stored in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage, and can be restored as new volumes to any availability domain within the same region they are stored. This capability provides you with a spare copy of a volume and gives you the ability to successfully complete disaster recovery within the same region.
Don't you think D is also correct?

The backups feature of the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Block Volume service lets you make a point-in-time snapshot of the data on a block volume. These backups can then be restored to new volumes either immediately after a backup or at a later time that you choose.

choices.D: It can be restored as new volumes with different sizes from the backups.
choices.A: It can be restored as new volumes to any Availability Domain within the same region.
choices.B: It must be restored as new volumes to the same Availability Domain on which the original block volume backup resides.
choices.C: It can be restored as new volumes to any Availability Domain across different regions.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about restoring a block volume from a manual or policy-based block volume backup?
Which three are valid Terraform configuration components? (Choose three.)
Which three components can you configure in Oracle Infrastructure Identity and Access Management? (Choose three.)

comments.content: Oh really? Thank you for enlightening us. Which other questions do we need to answer on our own without needed to go through cloud basics?

discussion.content:
If you cannot answer this question on your own, you need to go through cloud basic ;)

A, B and D are correct

questions.question_text: Which two are NOT an image source when launching a new compute instance? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
C, D. 
"To create a Linux instance, ...Choose an image or boot volume, and then click Select Image or Select Boot Volume."
Ref: https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Compute/Tasks/launchinginstance.htm
C, D Object and Bare Metal
C and D are correct, for custom image and boot volumes are our sources

comments.content: Browse all images: also includes boot volumes*

discussion.content:
Browse all images:
Platform images, oracle images, partner images, custom images, image OCID

Image OCID - if the custom image is stored in object storage, we can provide the OCID to have that image.

C, D seems to be an answer.
NOT an image source -- C and D
